meanings.sent1: The farmer kibbled the wheat to make it easier for the animals to eat.
meanings.sent2: She kibbled the corn to prepare it for the chickens.
meanings.sent3: The noisy machine kibbled the grains so loudly that the chickens started dancing!
meanings.sent4: The old mill kibbled the grains with the force of a thousand stampeding horses.
meanings.sent5: The chef kibbled the spices with precision, creating a flavorful blend.

meanings.definition: Coarsely ground grain used as animal feed.
meanings.sent1: The farmer bought a bag of kibbled grains for his livestock.
meanings.sent2: The kibbled corn was a favorite among the farm animals.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous goat managed to spill the kibbled feed all over the barn floor.
meanings.sent4: The kibbled grains in the trough disappeared quickly as the hungry pigs feasted.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the kibbled feed filled the air, attracting all the hungry animals.
